image.altText: A few ambulances lined up at the bottom of a ramp at a hosptial.

props.synopsis: A proposal to ban ambulance ramping at Tasmanian hospitals, put forward by the Tasmanian Liberals, is effectively scrapped by the Department of Health after the nursing and midwifery union raised concerns about safety and staffing.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals' plan to 'ban' ambulance ramping scrapped by Health Department

image.altText: albanese clean energy

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's set-piece policy announcement on Thursday was not short on ambition, but for now was mostly a re-announcement. What are the prospects of his future made in Australia?

title.children: The PM is heralding the dawn of a new manufacturing era, but it may not be so simple

image.altText: An old man wears a hat and a mask and holds a book up to hide his face

props.synopsis: With media cameras in position outside court, paedophile John Wayne Millwood pulled an item from his satchel bag. He held it in front of his face as he walked past. The item had his victim's name on it.

title.children: As cameras followed him, a paedophile held up an item with his victim's name on it

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit waves to a crowd and smiles.

props.synopsis: Newly minted Jacqui Lambie Network MPs say they have done a deal with the Rockliff Liberal government to "provide confidence and stability". But the details of the deal have left many wondering whether the Lambies have muzzled themselves.

title.children: Did the Lambie MPs get a dud deal? Many seasoned politicians think so

image.altText: The inside of the stadium showing crowds, people on the field and fireworks.

props.synopsis: The 2032 Brisbane Olympics have caused a stir at home over stadium plans but for the International Olympic Committee a higher-stakes game is being played.

title.children: The battle for the future of the Olympic Games is being played out in Brisbane and it's about more than stadiums

image.altText: Julian Assange seen through the window of a police van.

props.synopsis: An off-the-cuff remark by Joe Biden has taken the world by surprise and evoked hopes among the supporters of Julian Assange that the US President may be considering Australia's request to drop his prosecution. Here are five quick questions on the comments and how we got here.

title.children: What could Joe Biden's comments about Julian Assange mean?

image.altText: Women dressed in blue line up outside a building

props.synopsis: A man won a discrimination decision after being refused to a ladies lounge in a Tasmanian art gallery; it has raised questions about the law — and how men-only clubs can exist.

title.children: A man won a discrimination decision after being refused to a ladies lounge, so how do men's clubs exist?

image.altText: A drone shot of a mostly sunken ship wreck near a beach.

props.synopsis: An untold amount of black, toxic oil is contained within the corroding wrecks of World War II ships scattered around the Pacific. And it's leaking into the ocean.

title.children: These rusting shipwrecks are a big drawcard for divers. They're also ticking time bombs

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton repeats that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese missed a chance to respond strongly to protests outside the Opera House against Israel in October last year, as he again compares the moment to the Port Arthur massacre.

title.children: Peter Dutton doubles down on comparing pro-Palestine protest and Port Arthur massacre responses

image.altText: $100 Australian dollar notes.

props.synopsis: The bosses of Aldi are fronting a Senate inquiry examining supermarket prices and market power in Australia, while a fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower after data showed US consumer prices rose more than expected in March.

title.children: As it happened: RBA says Australians back cash over digital alternative, Aldi fronts supermarket inquiry

image.altText: A Qatar Airways Airbus A350-900 on the tarmac on a lightly cloudy day.

props.synopsis: The justice finds the incident did not happen on board the plane or by the airline's employees and as such, an international aviation convention does not apply.

title.children: Federal Court throws out case against Qatar Airways over invasive and degrading strip searches

image.altText: Casuarina Prison drone

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard it's been "impossible" to keep at-risk detainees safe from self-harming at WA's troubled Unit 18 since it was created. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Cleveland Dodd inquest hears nurse's emotional letter to boy's family, calling his death 'complete tragedy'

image.altText: A for lease sign at a picket fence

props.synopsis: Australian renters facing all-time high asking rents and record low vacancy rates across the country, but there could be relief in sight.

title.children: 'Never-ending run of rent rises' expected to hit a 'tipping point' later this year as population growth slows

image.altText: Lindsey Graham speaks at a podium while Donald Trump watches from behind.

props.synopsis: The former president hoped his abortion video would take the issue "out of play" before November's US election, but even some of his allies are determined not to let that happen.

title.children: Trump's anger at a Republican ally exposes his election ploy – and how it threatens to backfire

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The man charged with murdering police officer Jason Doig in a shooting in the SA's south-east will admit to the "objective elements" of the offence but is investigating a mental health defence, his lawyer says.

title.children: Man charged with murdering SA Police officer could mount mental health defence, lawyer says

image.altText: A stylised image of a mother cradling a baby.

props.synopsis: Damning claims by an SA government whistleblower have been levelled against the way child protection authorities are removing newborns from their mothers at public hospitals, sometimes just minutes after giving birth.

title.children: A whistleblower says mothers who 'haven't actually completed the birthing process' are having babies removed

image.altText: A grey building with a blue sign that reads Mulcahy and Co.

props.synopsis: A Victorian accounting firm and a related company have been ordered to pay more than $26 million to two former clients after using confidential information to take advantage of a business opportunity.

title.children: Accounting firm ordered to pay $26m over 'betrayal' of client

image.altText: Search crew standing in between two police vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police are expected to continue their search for the body of missing woman Samantha Murphy on Friday, after spending Thursday scouring a new area of bushland near Ballarat.

title.children: Fresh search for Samantha Murphy to resume Friday after wrapping for day

image.altText: Paul Marsh

props.synopsis: Paul Marsh says the AFL has created double standards in its treatment of Jeremy Finlayson compared to Alastair Clarkson after they both made homophobic remarks.

title.children: Players association boss hits out at 'consistently inconsistent' AFL over Finlayson ban for homophobia

image.altText: Three people pose for a photo on old steps.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff is one major step closer to continuing the Liberals rule after inking an agreement with the three Jacqui Lambie Network MPs — but the details of the deal have been slammed as making the trio "nothing more than puppets of the Liberal Party".

title.children: Jacqui Lambie trio deal with Rockliff slammed as giving Liberals 'blank cheque', Independent says

image.altText: man in navy suit in front of microphone

props.synopsis: Despite concluding that former NSW minister Tim Crakanthorp breached public trust by failing to disclose family property holdings, the Independent Commission Against Corruption said there was no finding of corrupt conduct.

title.children: Released ICAC report reveals former minister Tim Crakanthorp breached public trust

image.altText: A man with a shaved head, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says personal income tax has increased by a "record" 23 per cent since Labor came to power. RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: Fact check: Have personal income taxes risen by a 'record' 23 per cent under Anthony Albanese?

image.altText: A worker wearing a face mask works on a production line manufacturing bicycle steel rims in China.

props.synopsis: The prime minister sees an agenda to grow local green manufacturing as not only economically and strategically vital, but a political no-brainer. But that's only if it all works.

title.children: Albanese says a change as big as the industrial revolution is coming — you could call it the 'government intervention revolution'

image.altText: President Biden wears sunglasses in a suit speaks behind a lectern to a journalist.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden indicates the United States could abandon its prosecution of the Australian WikiLeaks founder ahead of revealing plans to develop an integrated missile defence system with Australia and Japan.

title.children: Biden 'considering' dropping pursuit of Assange as US, Australia plan missile system with Japan

image.altText: South Korean male politician stands in the centre of a room surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: South Korea's liberal opposition parties score a landslide victory in a parliamentary election held on Wednesday, dealing a resounding blow to President Yoon Suk Yeol and his conservative party.

title.children: South Korean ruling party suffers bruising defeat in parliamentary election

image.altText: An Australian man wearing a blue pacific themed shirt with a Papua New Guinean man in suit shaking hands

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will mark Anzac Day on the Kokoda Track, a few months after Australia and Papua New Guinea signed a sweeping security agreement.

title.children: While Albanese walks the Kokoda Track this Anzac Day, China's foreign minister could be in PNG for other reasons

image.altText: A handcuffed man being led by two police officers.

props.synopsis: Christopher Weaver claimed in court his partner had requested she be injected with the heroin, but the judge found "he has to be accountable for his offending".

title.children: Man jailed for fatally injecting partner with heroin during anniversary celebration in Canberra

image.altText: Young woman wearing patterned blouse, with hair pulled back by loose headscarf, standing on bridge with trees in background.

props.synopsis: What's driving so many Australians to take to the streets to speak out about the war in Gaza? Some are connected to the cause, others are embracing activism for the first time.

title.children: Shula has been called a 'traitor' by some in her former community. She wants to offer them a challenge

image.altText: A young girl in a red dress lies in a hospital bed, smiling, giving the thumbs up signal, with a toy dog.

props.synopsis: Juiced TV is a world first — a show made for kids in hospital by kids in hospital, and it's proved so beneficial at the Queensland Children's Hospital there are plans to roll it out nationally.

title.children: Why a TV show starring kids in hospital is 'more important than people realise'

image.altText: a photo of guy in flannel shirt standing in front of house with solar panels

props.synopsis: More and more Australians choose to live off-grid, but one electrical engineer warns it is expensive and "not for wimps".

title.children: 'Off-grid living not for wimps': Are Australians ready for the great green transition?

image.altText: Jay Vine in hospital

props.synopsis: Jay Vine reveals he feared neurological damage after his crash in Spain, as the Australian takes his first steps on the road to recovery.

title.children: 'Can't believe that I will still be able to walk': Aussie cyclist Vine takes his first steps after 'scary' days following horror crash

image.altText: The earth with a black shadow over it.

props.synopsis: After millions of people looked up to the sky to view Monday's total solar eclipse, NASA has shared incredible images of what the event looked like for those in space.

title.children: Astronauts share view of total solar eclipse from International Space Station

image.altText: A screenshot of someone being prompted to use the Palestinian flag emoji when they type the word Jerusalem into their iPhone.

props.synopsis: When iPhone users who have downloaded the latest software update type in the word "Jerusalem", they will see a prompt for the Palestinian flag emoji. Here's why that may have happened.

title.children: How an iPhone text 'bug' sparked global speculation that Apple staff were staging a small protest over Palestine
